BiblioData.Title: Sidewall functionalization of carbon nanotubes with organosilanes for polymer composites
BiblioData.Abstract: The present invention is directed to methods of functionalizing carbon nanotubes (CNTs), particularly single-wall carbon nanotubes (SWNTs), with organosilane species, wherein such functionalization enables fabrication of advanced polymer composites. The present invention is also directed toward the functionalized CNTs, advanced CNT-polymer composites made with such functionalized CNTs, and methods of making such advanced CNT-polymer composites.

Claims.P: 1. A composite material comprising:
a) carbon nanotubes (CNTs);
b) a quantity of fiber reinforcement material; and
c) polymer, wherein the CNTs serve as a bridge, chemically binding the fiber reinforcement material with the polymer.
2. The composite material of claim 1, wherein the CNTs are silane-functionalized.
3. The composite material of claim 1 or claim 2, wherein the CNTs are SWNTs.
4. The composite material of any of claims 1 to 3, wherein the fiber einforcement material is silane-functionalized.
5. The composite material of any of claims 1 to 4, wherein the fiber reinforcement material is glass fibers, wherein optionally the glass fibers have been resized.
6. The composite material of claim 5, wherein the glass fibers are present in the form of woven sheets.
7. The composite material of claim 6, wherein such woven sheets are stacked together with silane-functionalized CNTs and polymer between them.
8. The composite material of any of claims 1 to 7, wherein the polymer material is epoxy.
9. A method comprising :
a) adding carbon nanotubes (CNTs) to a quantity of fiber reinforcement material to form CNT-coated fibers;
b) contacting polymer material with the CNT-coated fibers to form composite material comprising CNTs, a fiber reinforcement material, and polymer material.
10. The method of claim 9, wherein the quantity of fiber reinforcement material comprises glass fiber, wherein optionally the glass fiber is resized with organosilane species.
11. The method of claim 9 or claim 10, wherein the CNTs are silane-functionalized.
12. The method of any of claims 9 to 11, wherein the step of adding CNTs to the fiber reinforcement material to form CNT-coated fibers comprises an incipient wetting process, which comprises:
a) dispersing CNTs and fiber reinforcement material in a solvent to form a mixture; and
b) removing said solvent to leave the fibers coated with CNTs.
13. The method of claim 12, wherein the CNTs are functionalized.

14. The method of any of claims 9 to 13, wherein the CNTs are chemically bound to the fiber reinforcement material through functional groups originating on either or both of the CNTs and fiber reinforcement material.

15. The method of any of claims 9 to 14, wherein the polymer material is selected from the group consisting of thermosets, thermoplastics, epoxies, vinylesters, polyester, bismaleimide, polystyrene, polybutadiene or polyisoprene and combinations thereof.
16. The method of any of claims 9 to 15, wherein the polymer material comprises at least one polymer precursor.
17. The method of claim 15 or claim 16 further comprising a step of polymerizing and/or curing the at least one polymer precursor.
18. The method of any of claims 9 to 17, wherein the fiber reinforcement material is sized with the CNTs.
19. The method of any of claims 9 to 18, wherein either or both of the CNTs and the fiber reinforcing material are chemically bound to the polymer material.
20. The method of any of claims 9 to 19 wherein the CNTs are selected from SWNTs, MWNTs, double-wall carbon nanotubes, and combinations thereof, wherein optionally the CNTs are SWNTs.
